decisions: Adopted a Draft PR policy for in-progress changes to maintain CI visibility without blocking merges.
Prioritized fixing validation scripts (markdown linting and session validation) ahead of lower-impact tooling issues.
lessons: Tooling instability (flaky CI and unreliable automation) is a major bottleneck for merge velocity.
A Draft PR policy is effective for surfacing work-in-progress early while protecting the main branch from unstable changes.
Standardizing pre-merge validation flows reduces lead time by minimizing back-and-forth on failing checks.

events.content: | MUST | Run markdown lint | [x] | npx markdownlint-cli2: 0 errors |
